sen.j: また、本来冷たい器にご飯を盛りその上に各種惣菜をのせて混ぜて食べる韓国料理「ビビンバ」について、近年に在日韓国人調理家と日本人調理家が共同で、岩から切り出した器を熱してその中にご飯と惣菜（通常の韓国料理には用いられない惣菜を載せるものも多い）を盛る「石焼ビビンバ」を考案した。
sen.e: Concerning "bibimbap," a Korean dish in which various side dishes are put on top of boiled rice placed originally in a not-heated bowl and both side dishes and rice are eaten mixed, a Korean cook residing in Japan and a Japanese cook have recently devised jointly "stone-roasted bibimbap," in which a bowl, cut out of rock, is heated and boiled rice and side dishes are placed in it (in many of such dishes, side dishes not used in traditional Korean dishes are provided).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Concerning "bibimbap," a Korean dish in which various side dishes are put on top of boiled rice placed originally in a non-heated bowl and both side dishes and rice are eaten from the mixture, a Korean cook residing in Japan and a Japanese cook have recently devised jointly "stone-roasted bibimbap," in which a bowl, cut out of rock, is heated and boiled rice and side dishes are placed in it (in many of such dishes, side dishes not used in traditional Korean dishes are provided).

sen.j: そうすると好評を博し、現在では韓国に逆輸出されて「トル（岩）ソ（焼き）ビビンパプ」と呼ばれて現地で定番化している。
sen.e: Then having been accepted favorably, the dish style has been re-exported to Korea and has firmly been established there as a regular dish called "dolsot bibimbap."

sen.j: これなどは、広義の日本料理（韓風和食）であるにもかかわらず、当の韓国人も日本人も日本料理としてではなく韓国料理であると認識している。
sen.e: Although this dish is nihon-ryori (Korean-style wa-shoku" in the broad sense, Japanese as well as Korean recognize the dish as a Korean dish rather than a Japanese dish.

sen.j: しかし「石焼湯葉カツオビビンバ」など、もはや日本料理なのか韓国料理なのか明確に判別しかねるものも増えている。
sen.e: However, as exemplified by "the stone-roasted yuba (a soy bean-processed product), bonito bibimbap," there have appeared many dishes that can not be identified clearly as Japanese dishes or Korean dishes.

sen.j: 寿司については、古代に東南アジア特にタイ王国やメコン川流域で発明された魚肉と米を合えて発酵されたものである。
sen.e: Boiled rice dressed with fish meat is fermented to make sushi, and this method was invented in Southeastern Asia, in particular, in the Kingdom of Thailand and in the Mekong River basin in ancient times.

sen.j: 平安時代から江戸時代にかけて日本独自の酢飯文化として発展・定着した。
sen.e: Then in the era from the Heian period to the Edo period, the sushi-eating habit was developed and established as vinegared rice-eating culture specific to Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the Heian to the Edo period, the sushi-eating habit was developed and established as vinegared rice-eating culture specific to Japan.

sen.j: 近年、その「日本料理としての寿司」は世界各国で「日本料理」として認識されている。
sen.e: In recent years, "sushi as nihon-ryori" has been recognized as "nihon-ryori" throughout the world.

sen.j: しかしながら、アメリカ合衆国・中華人民共和国・大韓民国などで食べられているアボカド・キャビアなど従来寿司ネタとして使われることなど予想もされなかった食材を使った寿司が日本に逆輸入されている。
sen.e: However, in the United State, People's Republic of China and Republic of Korea, avocado and caviar are used as topping foodstuffs of sushi, which have not been supposed to be used in Japan before, and the sushi style using such foodstuffs have been impoted to Japan.

sen.j: その他、一般の日本人向けの商業商品においても、タイ王国のスープ料理として名高い「トムヤム」スープ風味の「トムヤム茶漬けの素」、ベトナム麺を本来ベトナム人は食べない高菜を用いてうどん質を全く変えてご当地化した「盛岡冷麺」、牛肉の照り焼きを米で挟んだ「ライスバーガー」など、果たして日本料理なのか異国料理なのか判別に悩むものも多数存在する。
sen.e: There exist many other commercialized products for Japanese in general, whose identification, whether they are nihon-ryori dish or foreign dishes, is difficult to be made: For examples, "the essence of tom yam chazuke (boiled rice with tea poured over it" with the flavor of the "tom yam" soup famous as a soup dish in Kingdom of Thailand, "the Morioka reimen (cold noodles)," the pho (Vietnamese noodle soup) Japanized by completely changing the udon nature using the leaf mustard that Vietnamese never eat originally, and "rice burger" in which boiled rice is placed on the both sides of a teriyaki (grilling with soy sauce and sugar) beef.

Many other commercialized products exist in Japan that are difficult for Japanese to tell whether they are nihon-ryori dishes or foreign dishes for example;"the essence of tom yam chazuke (boiled rice with tea poured over it" with the flavor of the "tom yam" soup famous as a soup dish in the Kingdom of Thailand, "the Morioka reimen (cold noodles)," the pho (Vietnamese noodle soup) Japanized by completely changing the udon nature using the leaf mustard that Vietnamese never ate originally, and "rice burger" in which boiled rice is placed on the both sides of a teriyaki (grilled with soy sauce and sugar) beef paddy.

sen.j: いずれにしても、他の料理と同じく「日本料理」も、古来の伝統保守の傾向とともに異国料理との混合や相互影響を受ける面を持っている。
sen.e: Anyhow, "nihon-ryori dishes," as well as other dishes, have the aspect of affecting and being affected by foreign dishes in addition to the tendency of maintaining the tradition from ancient times.

sen.j: 同時に日本食ブームに後押しされ他国の料理文化に対しても多くの影響を及ぼしている。
sen.e: At the same time, nihon-ryori dishes have much affected cooking culture of other nations, helped by Japanese dish booms.

sen.e: At the same time, nihon-ryori dishes have greatly affected the cooking culture of other nations, spurred on by Japanese dish trends.

sen.j: 総じていえば、日本料理は近代化の洗礼を受けながら、自分で食材を採集し、食器を整えた前近代の食事事情の名残を今なお残しているといえよう。
sen.e: Generally speaking, it can be said that, although having undergone modernization, nihon-ryori dishes still maintain the reminiscence of the eating situations before modern times when people collected their foodstuffs by themselves and prepared their own tableware.

Generally speaking, although having undergone modernization, nihon-ryori dishes still maintain the reminiscence of eating before modern times when people collected food by themselves and prepared their own tableware.

sen.j: 一般的に米をはじめとする穀物、野菜、豆類、果物などの農作物、魚介類や海藻といった海産物、鳥類の肉などがよく使われる。
sen.e: Generally, farm products, such as grain, including rice, vegetables, beans, and fruits, marine products, such as fishes and shellfishes and seaweed, and meat, such as that of birds, are used mostly.

sen.j: 仏教の影響ゆえに獣肉の利用は比較的発達しておらず、乳製品をほとんど使わず、これらのたんぱく源の代用として大豆加工品が好まれる、といった特徴をもつ。
sen.e: The features are as follows: Due to influence of Buddhism, use of animal food has not been developed well, almost no dairy product is used, and soybean-processed products are favored for taking in protein.

sen.j: 特に、海産物を生食すること、海藻を好んで食べることは海外ではあまり見られず、日本料理の大きな特徴といえる。
sen.e: In particular, it can be said a great feature of nihon-ryori, rarely seen in other nations, that marine products are eaten uncooked and eating seaweed is favored.

sen.j: 調味は出汁を基本とし、塩味をつけるのには塩のほか、うま味を豊富に含んだ醤油、味噌などの大豆発酵調味料が基本的な調味料として用いられる。
sen.e: Seasoning is based on soup stock, and fermented soybean seasonings, such as soy sauce and miso (bean paste) which include lots of umami (giving good taste) ingredients, in addition to salt for salty flavor.

sen.j: 日本酒や米酢などの米発酵調味料も多用される。
sen.e: Fermented rice seasonings, such as Japanese sake rice wine and rice vinegar, are also used for many dishes.

sen.j: 甘みには水飴・みりんが使われるが、現代では砂糖を使うことも多い。
sen.e: For sweet tastes, starch syrup or mirin (sweet cooking rice wine) has been used, but nowadays, sugar is often used as well.

sen.e: A little amount of vegetable oil, such as canola oil and sesame oil, is used, but almost no animal oil, such as lard, is used.

sen.j: 総じて低脂肪、高塩分であるとされることが多い。

sen.j: 野菜としても扱われる ネギは別として、香辛料やハーブの類は少量使われ、大量に用いられることはない。
sen.e: Excluding the green onion that is used as vegetable as well, only a small amount of spice and herb is used but they are never used in a significant amount.

sen.j: 使用する香辛料の種類も他国の料理に比べれば少ない。

sen.j: 他の料理に比べて食材を洗ったり煮たりする事が多く、水を多用する。
sen.e: Many of the foodstuffs are washed and/or boiled, and therefore, lots of water is used compared with those for other dishes.

sen.j: 彩りを出し、素材の味を楽しむために、味付け前の下処理に手間をかける。

sen.j: 日本料理の料理長を『板前』という事から分かる通り、食材の切り方に凝る傾向がある。
sen.e: As known from the fact that the chief cook for nihon-ryori dishes is called "itamae" (literally, in front of a (cutting) board), there is a tendency that the cooks concentrate their efforts in cutting foodstuffs.

sen.j: これは、平安時代の包丁式に由来し、珍しいものばかり食べる事によって権威を見せつけ、尚且つ、仏教の影響から味の美味いまずいを論じてはいけない、という考えからと、加熱調理は誰でも出来る、という考えから来たものである。
sen.e: This originates in the kitchen knife ceremony held in the Heian period, and is also based on the thought that, due to an influence of Buddhism, it should not be discussed whether a dish is tasty or not, while boasting authority by eating many rare things, and on the thought that anyone can make a dish by heating.

sen.j: 『焼く』という意味の単語が由来とされる、フランス語で台所や料理法を意味する『キュイジーヌ』(cuisine)とは対照的である。

sen.e: On the other hand, in a formal eating occasion, such as Kaiseki ryori (a simple meal served before a ceremonial tea: 懐石料理 in Japanese) and Kaiseki ryori (set of dishes served on an individual tray for entertaining guests: 会席料理 in Japanese), it is ordinary that a dish or a tray of dishes are served one after another.

sen.j: 料理の記述の文献初出は、『日本書紀』で磐鹿六雁命（イワカムツカリノミコト、高橋氏の祖先）であり、景行天皇が亡き日本武尊を偲んで安房の浮宮へ行幸した際にカツオとハマグリの膾を出した記述である。
sen.e: The first historical document concerned with cooking is "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), in which the following description is included: Iwakamutsukari no Mikoto (the ancestor of the Takahashi clan) served a dish of a bonito and hamaguri clams to Emperor Keiko when the emperor visited Ukimiya Shrine in Awa thinking of dead Yamato Takeru no Mikoto.

sen.e: In the Kanto region, strong soy sauce was used as seasoning even for shiru-mono dishes (soup dishes) and nimono (boiled and seasoned foods) so that the tastes of these dishes could be enjoyed even when they became cold, and dishes using such seasoning developed as souvenir dishes, for example, in the form of box lunches.

sen.j: 京都、大阪の料理は「上方料理」「関西料理」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Dishes in Kyoto and Osaka were called "kamigata-ryori" (dishes in kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka)) or "Kansai-ryori" (dishes in the Kansai region).

sen.j: 上方には北前船により日本海の海産物がもたらされ、北海道産の昆布の利用が発達した。
sen.e: Marine products were brought to kamigata by kitamae-bune (cargo ships that sailed the Japan Sea during the Edo period), and use of konbu from Hokkaido developed there.

sen.j: 華やかな江戸文化に対して京都は伝統的な優雅さが特徴でそれは料理の上にも反映された。
sen.e: For the flamboyant Edo culture, that of Kyoto featured traditional elegance and this feature was reflected in the dishes as well.

sen.j: 京都は寺院料理の影響をうけ、また海産物に乏しいことから野菜や乾物を使った料理に発展をみた。
sen.e: Because dishes in Kyoto were affected by dishes at temples and marine products were unavailable abundantly, dishes using vegetables and dried foodstuffs developed.

sen.j: 豆腐、ゆばなどの細やかな味を生かすために薄味の料理法が発達した。

sen.j: 干しダラや身欠ニシンなどの保存食を上手に料理するのも特徴であった。
sen.e: Its features also included skillfully cooking preservative foods, such as dried cods and dried filleted herrings.

sen.j: 一方、商業都市として発展をみた大阪は海に近く、魚介も豊かで地方の産物も集まるところから、「天下の台所」と謳われるほどであった。
sen.e: On the other hand, because Osaka, having devloped as a commercial city, was placed near to sea, fishes and seashells were availabe abundantly there and foodstuffs from other areas gathered there as well, being called the kitchen of Japan.

sen.j: 作法よりも食べて旨い料理に主点が置かれ、冷たくしてお土産に持ち帰る料理よりその場で食べてしまう料理という視点が強かった。
sen.e: Importance was placed on delicious dishes rather than on eating etiquette, and people there considered that dishes should be eaten at the places they were cooked, rather than being taken out as a souvenir in cold states.

sen.j: 明治になると、神仏分離、廃仏毀釈により肉食が解禁されすき焼きなどが登場した。
sen.e: Entering the Meiji period, due to the movements of separating Buddhism from Shintoism and of abolishing Buddhism, it became permitted to eat meat, and sukiyaki (thin slices of beef, cooked with various vegetables in a table-top cast-iron pan) appeared.
